intro: Hedyotis spermacocoides, commonly known as the small red root or red root grass, is a small, herbaceous plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or along stream banks. The plant features tiny, clustered white or pale yellow flowers and small, elliptical leaves. Its root system is fibrous and often used in traditional medicine. Hedyotis spermacocoides is part of the Rubiaceae family, which includes many other flowering plants with similar botanical characteristics.
